titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Paul Cronin Anti-War Protest Photographs TAM.637
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Heather Mulliner

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-04-03T14:27-0400

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.physloc: Materials are located at the Tamiment Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains roughly 400 black and white photogrphs pertaining to student anti-war protests in the 1960s and early 1970s. The majority of these photographs relate to student anti-war protest in the United States, but several also relate to foreign protests and other general anti-war protests in the United States, most notably the Poor People's Campaign of 1968. Other notable topics covered in this collection include protests at San Francisco State University Protests and University of California Berkely, and the "Stop the Draft" demonstration led by pacifics Linda Morse.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: These photographs have been grouped thematically and cover either specific events or general anti-war protests. Folders have been arranged chronologically.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated in 2013 by Paul Cronin. The accession number associated with this gift is 2013.042.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Paul Cronin (1972, London) is co-founder of Sticking Place Films, a production and distribution company in London. His films include Look out Haskell, Itâ€™s real!, The Making of Medium Cool (2001), Film as a Subversive Art: Amos Vogel and Cinema 16 (2003), and In the Beginning was the Image: Conversations with Peter Whitehead (2006). He is also the editor of several books on the film industry, including Herzog on Herzog and Alexander Mackendrick's On Film-Making: An Introduction to the Craft of the Director. Cronin is currently he working on A Time to Stir, an historical documentary about the student protests at Columbia University in 1968, set to be released in 2018.

appraisal.head: Appraisal note
appraisal.p: No materials were separated from this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged by subject and then chronologically by year.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were moved into archival housing, a preliminary file list was created, and a collection-level finding aid was created to describe these materials. Photographs have been grouped by subject.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright has been retained by the creator.
